title: Build comprehensive sidebar navigation with full UI pages (Stage 1)

requirements.text: Replace the existing sidebar navigation with a comprehensive design including navigation items: Home, Books, Authors, Trending, Upload Book, and Profile. Maintain the collapsible/expandable behavior with smooth transitions and dynamic content resizing that already exists in Version 24.

quotes: Replace existing sidebar with full navigation: Home, Books, Authors, Trending, Upload Book, Profile

acceptanceCriteria: Sidebar contains all six navigation items: Home, Books, Authors, Trending, Upload Book, Profile
Collapsible/expandable behavior works smoothly with content resizing
Navigation items link to their respective pages
Sidebar maintains localStorage persistence for collapsed/expanded state

requirements.text: Update the sidebar styling to use blue, gold, and white as primary colors with Van Gogh-inspired subtle textures. Ensure light/dark mode support is maintained and the sidebar adapts seamlessly with the page theme.

quotes: Blue, gold, and white color scheme with Van Gogh-inspired textures
Light/dark mode support with persistent localStorage preferences

acceptanceCriteria: Sidebar uses blue, gold, and white colors consistently
Van Gogh-inspired textures are applied subtly to the sidebar
Light and dark mode both render correctly with appropriate color adjustments
Theme preference persists across sessions via localStorage

requirements.text: Create a Home page that displays a hero section with personalized book recommendations and trending books. The page content should expand to fill available space when the sidebar collapses. Use placeholder data for recommendations initially.

quotes: Home page with hero section and recommendation areas
Expands the page content to fill available space when sidebar collapses

acceptanceCriteria: Home page displays a hero section at the top
Personalized recommendations section shows placeholder book cards
Trending books section displays placeholder books
Page content dynamically resizes when sidebar state changes
Navigation from sidebar 'Home' item successfully routes to this page

requirements.text: Build a Books browse page with advanced search input, filter dropdowns for genres and authors, and sorting options. Display books in mood-based carousels with trending sections and personalized book cards. Use placeholder data for the initial implementation.

quotes: Books browse page with search, filters, and mood-based carousels
Features advanced search, filters, and sorting options

acceptanceCriteria: Page includes a search input field for books
Filter dropdowns for genre and author selection are functional
Sorting options (e.g., by rating, title, date) are available
Books display in mood-based horizontal carousels
Trending section highlights popular books
Navigation from sidebar 'Books' item routes to this page

requirements.text: Create an Authors list page that displays all authors with avatars and brief bios. Each author entry should be clickable and navigate to their public profile page. Use placeholder data for author avatars, bios, and profiles initially.

quotes: Authors list page with avatars and bios
Clicking an author opens their public profile

acceptanceCriteria: Page displays a list or grid of authors
Each author shows an avatar image and brief bio
Clicking an author navigates to their profile page
Navigation from sidebar 'Authors' item routes to this page
Uses placeholder data for all author information

requirements.text: Build a Trending page that displays trending or popular books and collections. Highlight currently popular moods, genres, and top-rated books using placeholder data.

quotes: Trending page for popular books and collections
Highlights currently popular moods, genres, and top-rated books

acceptanceCriteria: Page displays a section for trending books
Popular moods are highlighted with visual indicators
Top-rated books section shows highly-rated placeholder books
Genre-based trending sections are visible
Navigation from sidebar 'Trending' item routes to this page

requirements.text: Create an Upload Book page or modal with a form for book file upload, metadata entry (title, author, description, genre), cover image upload, and series management fields. Display the form in a semi-transparent modal overlay with blur effects. Make it accessible to all users for now (authentication and author-only access will be added in Stage 3).

quotes: Upload Book page/modal (UI only, accessible to all for now)
Supports book file upload, metadata entry, cover image, and series management

acceptanceCriteria: Upload Book form is accessible from sidebar navigation
Form includes fields for: book file upload, title, author, description, genre, cover image
Series management fields (series name, book order) are included
Modal overlay has semi-transparent background with blur effect
Form has submit and cancel buttons
Currently accessible to all users without authentication checks

requirements.text: Build a Profile page that displays the user's avatar, name, bio, reading lists, and favorites. Include visible UI buttons for 'Log Out' and 'Delete Account' account actions. The Log Out button should clear the session and redirect to the landing page. The Delete Account button should open a confirmation modal and, upon confirmation, redirect to the landing page. Use placeholder data for profile information initially.

quotes: Profile page with reading lists, favorites, and account actions (Log Out/Delete Account buttons)
Log Out / Sign Out: clears session, redirects to landing page
Delete Account: confirmation modal, deletes all user data, redirects to landing page

acceptanceCriteria: Profile page displays user avatar, name, and bio
Reading lists section shows placeholder books
Favorites section displays bookmarked books
Log Out button is visible and functional (clears session, redirects to landing page)
Delete Account button opens a confirmation modal
Delete Account confirmation modal has cancel and confirm buttons
Upon Delete Account confirmation, user is redirected to landing page
Navigation from sidebar 'Profile' item routes to this page

requirements.text: Add social feature UI elements throughout the platform including followers/following counters, review sections on book pages, and share functionality buttons. Display these elements with placeholder data and non-functional interactions for now (backend integration will come in Stage 2).

quotes: Social feature UI elements (followers/following counters, review sections, share buttons)
Followers / Following: track favorite authors or users
Reviews & Ratings: integrated into book pages and carousels

acceptanceCriteria: Followers/following counters appear on profile and author pages with placeholder numbers
Book detail pages include a reviews section showing placeholder reviews
Share buttons are visible on book pages and collections
All social elements use placeholder data
Interactions are visual only (no backend calls yet)

requirements.text: Ensure the sidebar and all new pages are fully responsive across desktop, tablet, and mobile devices. On mobile, the sidebar should collapse into a hamburger menu or overlay that can be toggled.

quotes: Fully responsive across desktop, tablet, and mobile
Responsive design for desktop, tablet, and mobile

acceptanceCriteria: Sidebar renders correctly on desktop, tablet, and mobile screens
On mobile, sidebar collapses into a hamburger menu or overlay
All new pages (Home, Books, Authors, Trending, Upload Book, Profile) are responsive
Content adjusts appropriately for different screen sizes
Touch interactions work smoothly on mobile devices

constraints: Do not implement backend data models or CRUD operations in this build (Stage 2)
Do not implement Internet Identity authentication or role-based access control in this build (Stage 3)
Use placeholder/mock data for all books, authors, reviews, followers, and social features
Maintain the existing collapsible sidebar behavior and localStorage persistence from Version 24
Follow the Van Gogh-inspired design theme with blue, gold, and white colors
Keep all pages accessible to all users regardless of authentication status for now
nonGoals: Backend Motoko data models for Books, Authors, Users, Reviews, Followers
Functional social features (actual following, reviewing, sharing)
Author-only restrictions on Upload Book page
